member.name: T:Ptv.Components.Projections.Direct.CoordinateTransformations
member.summary: Defines frequently used managed coordinate transformation routines.

remarks.para: The provided routines are mainly used by to implement a direct coordinate transformation given a source and target identifier of a coordinate reference system.
The coordinate transformations may be used directly. The z-coordinate of the transformation methods can be ignored (reserved for future use).

member.name: M:Ptv.Components.Projections.Proj4.WktExtensions.Decompress(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Decompresses a WKT record.
member.param: The current WKT record.
The last WKT record.
member.returns: The decompressed WKT record.
member.remarks:
Decompression is based on the assumption:
- first record contains a full WKT description
- all other records are in the form "l;wkt;r" with wkt being a remainder and l and r the numbers of characters to reuse from the previous WKT description (from left and right respectively).

summary.para: The namespace contains the classes that are essential for projecting or transforming coordinates in GIS-like applications.
is the main class for the transformations, offering a set of methods for transforming coordinates specified either as System.Windows.Point, or simply using doubles.

uses to describe the source and the target of a transformation. The provides well known coordinate reference systems and provides an access using CRS identifiers (e.g. EPSG:4326). See classes CoordinateReferenceSystem.Mapserver and CoordinateReferenceSystem.XServer, which provide an access for PTV legacy systems.

At its base, the coordinate transformation uses the PROJ.4 Cartographic Projections Library. The included is initialized on startup with specific PTV coordinate reference systems as well as other well known systems taken from an internal EPSG database, defining the coordinate reference systems in the Proj4 well known text format. A good and short summary on EPSG and its codes is provided by Wikipedia (german article). A good source for any coordinate reference system that might be missing is www.spatialreference.org.

member.name: T:Ptv.Components.Projections.Location
member.summary: Represents an x- and y-coordinate pair with an optional z-coordinate.
member.remarks: The struct uses double precision coordinates and has been introduced to handle special coordinate transformations where a z-coordinate is mandatory. For the sake of differentiation the struct has been named Location, as several other point structs and classes exist ( System.Windows.Point, System.Drawing.Point, System.Drawing.PointF and others). In most cases it is not necessary to work with Location at all, as the basic transformation routines provided through are designed to work with System.Windows.Point as well.

member.name: T:Ptv.Components.Projections.Registry
member.summary: Manages coordinate reference systems in a reusable way.

remarks.para: The stores instances and provides an access using CRS identifiers, e.g. EPSG:4326.

On startup, the is initialized from an internal EPSG database so that it is ready to provide access to all well known coordinate reference systems, e.g. EPSG:4326 (WGS84), EPSG:76131 (PTV Mercator) or EPSG:3857 (Google Mercator) to name a few. At the very base, the EPSG database included was generated out of the EPSG Geodetic Parameter Dataset, which is maintained by the Geodesy Subcommittee of OGP. In addition to those EPSG codes, aliases are injected (e.g. CoordinateReferenceSystem.Mapserver, CoordinateReferenceSystem.XServer) to make the access more convenient. For the rare case that coordinate reference systems are missing, coordinate reference systems can be added or overwritten using Registry.Add.

member.name: T:Ptv.Components.Projections.Distance
member.summary: Provides distance calculation routines.

member.name: M:Ptv.Components.Projections.Distance.GetHaversineDistance(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the haversine distance between to points, specified as lon/lat, aka WGS84, aka EPSG:4326.
member.param: Longitude of first point, in degress
Latitude of first point, in degress
Longitude of second point, in degress
Latitude of second point, in degress
member.returns: Haversine distance in [km].

member.name: M:Ptv.Components.Projections.Distance.GetHaversineDistance(Ptv.Components.Projections.CoordinateReferenceSystem,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Extension method that calculates the haversine distance between to points using a specific coordinate reference system.
member.param: Coordinate reference system
X-coordinate of first point
Y-coordinate of first point
X-coordinate of second point
Y-coordinate of second point
member.returns: Haversine distance in [km].
member.remarks: This extension has been provided for convenience reasons only. It is good enough for single coordinates but should be used in batch processing scenarios where performance is an issue. On each call this extension method gets a coordinate transformation for transforming from the specified CRS to EPSG:4326, transforms the specified coordinates to EPSG:4326 and finally uses the transformed coordinates with the default, lon/lat based haversine distance calculation. When it comes to mass-calculations it is recommended to cache and re-use any coordinate transformation necessary by the client thus avoid per coordinate transformation lookups.

member.name: T:Ptv.Components.Projections.Custom.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The namespace contains classes implementing custom pre- and post-transformations for use with .

member.name: T:Ptv.Components.Projections.Custom.CustomTransformation
member.summary: Utility class introducing nested pre- and post-transformation routines.

remarks.para: Custom transformations have been introduced to be able to offer special coordinate reference systems such as PTV GeoMinSek or PTV Geodecimal, which are based on WGS84 but differ in formatting.
Custom transformations are also used to handle simple RAD/DEG conversions which are mandatory for any coordinate reference systems using latitude/longitude coordinates.

member.name: M:Ptv.Components.Projections.Custom.ShiftScaleTransformation.Pre(System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Pre-transforms the given coordinates.
member.remarks: Uses the formula c' = (c + shift) * scale) for the transformation, then passes the coordinates on to the inner custom transformation.
member.param: Value containing the x-coordinate (in and out).
Value containing the y-coordinate (in and out).

member.name: M:Ptv.Components.Projections.Custom.ShiftScaleTransformation.Post(System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Post-transforms the given coordinates.
member.remarks: Passes the coordinates on to the inner transformation, then transforms the coordinates using the formula c' = c / scale - shift.
member.param: Value containing the x-coordinate (in and out).
Value containing the y-coordinate (in and out).
